p.s: William Shakespeare'sSonnet 65 describes the inferiority and transitoriness of mortal things, just like humans, in comparison to time.
This sonnet is written in an iambic pentameter, just like every other Shakespearean sonnet.
On line is made up of five pairs called iambs.
An iamb is a metrical unit consisting of one untressed syllable followed by one stressed syllable.
In the first three quatrains, each containing four lines, the writer establishes a theme which he then resolves in th last two lines, called the couplet.
The rhyme scheme is the same as in English or Shakespearean sonnets ABAB CDCD EFEF GG.
So the quatrains consist of cross rhymes while the couplet consists of a pair rhyme.
Sonnet 65's overall theme is the passage of time.
Time and especially pasage of time is being portrayed as something inescapable for human beings and nature.
therefore we have no chance of beating time and escaping death.
